body:
I'm not leaving so chill xD

As many of you have noticed, I got demoted.
So I thought I'd talk about that today.

I was demoted for a number of reasons.
Inaccurate hack detection;
Rudeness, disrespect and arguing on the forums
Unsatisfactory forum moderating.
And possibly other reasons that I've missed.

I guess I'll put this here, it might be easier than explaining everything in a big essay..

( By the way, I'm laughing not because I'm finding anything funny, it's just what I do during conversations. I guess it's something I've always done.
I'm weird like that.
If you've talked to me on TeamSpeak you'd have probably already noticed that I laugh a lot so there you go xD )

I was demoted after being in the staff team for around 9 and a half months.

Promoted to Junior Moderator on 26/1/2015
Promoted to Moderator on 14/2/2015
Retired from Moderator on 28/9/2015
Returned to Moderator on 15/11/2015
Demoted from Moderator on 25/12/2015

It sucks to leave the staff team on a bad note via a demotion but that's life.


I guess my stupid mouth caught up with me in the end. I was never one to just sit by and watch when something stupid happens.
I always spoke my mind to anyone about anything, I wasn't intimidated by anyone and put my reputation on the line multiple times to stand up for what (I thought at least) was right. I guess I should have learnt when it was appropriate to talk and when to just stay out of it xD

I've had a ton of ups and downs during my time as staff but it truly has been a fun ride and I've appreciated every single moment I've shared with everyone during my time as staff. I've learnt quite a bit.


I have no intention of re-joining the staff team in the foreseeable future.

Thanks for listening.

I made this thread so I wouldn't have to keep explaining myself over and over.

I published the video because it would be easier for people to listen to a conversation as opposed to listening to me babbling on any more than I have too.

Demotion threads have been allowed on the forums in the past.

replies.body:
A cry for attention or a simple and honest explanation? There's a difference. For a moderator who worked to his best extent (but consequently not up to standards) for over 9 months to suddenly have his rank revoked can't just be left with no regards.

There's been other people explaining their own demotions and retirements before, but I haven't seen you making a post like this there.

Plus, this post saves having to explain what happened over and over for the next month. :P

replies.body:
Sorry to burst your bubble, but it doesn't take someone with perfect hack detection abilities to point out that another person has been statistically — Snow's probably rolling his eyes right now — proven not to have an ideal success rate with valid bans... falling below a certain standard is simply a fact. That's how criticism often works; the critic doesn't necessarily have to be the best at something to tell others that they're not doing well. I personally have no knowledge of the false bans Snow might have actually made, but if the senior staff determined that he wasn't up to par, then, well, so be it.

Hate to see you go, Snow... in the past, though your performance on the forums may have been questionable at times, you always managed to pull through in the end, but unfortunately that didn't happen this time (and on Christmas, too, what luckless and poor spirit). At least you were more active on the website in a day than I've been throughout my entirety as staff... I'll see you around.

replies.body:
Tbh I wasn't a massive fan of yours until about a month ago when I considered going for a staff position. Up until I was faced with the fact that I might soon be accepted to be in the shoes of a mod I can say that I had been extremely ignorant of how a staff member thinks.

A few weeks ago you gave me the final bit of inspiration and courage I needed to apply for staff. It was on a game on rendezvous and me and Possy were being treated to the delight that is Snow bowspam. I can still remember the ts banter as we failed over and over again to get past you. 

It was then I realised I'd judged you too quickly and that I'd never actually took the time to get to know you at all.

You were one of the most active mods and please know that most of us won't forget what you've done for the server.

Thank you Snow, I owe you for all you've taught me and I hope that all I do in my time as a mod will make you proud.

Nath

replies.body: You'd be surprised as to how many false bans Para has given out recently.
replies.body_tagged: You'd be surprised as to how many false bans Para has given out recently.

reply_to.body:
Sorry to burst your bubble, but it doesn't take someone with perfect hack detection abilities to point out that another person has been statistically — Snow's probably rolling his eyes right now — proven not to have an ideal success rate with valid bans... falling below a certain standard is simply a fact. That's how criticism often works; the critic doesn't necessarily have to be the best at something to tell others that they're not doing well. I personally have no knowledge of the false bans Snow might have actually made, but if the senior staff determined that he wasn't up to par, then, well, so be it.

Hate to see you go, Snow... in the past, though your performance on the forums may have been questionable at times, you always managed to pull through in the end, but unfortunately that didn't happen this time (and on Christmas, too, what luckless and poor spirit). At least you were more active on the website in a day than I've been throughout my entirety as staff... I'll see you around.

At least you were more active on the website in a day than I've been throughout my entirety as staff... I'll see you around.

replies.body: I didn't intend to sound biased. In any case, a demotion is still a penalization. "The infliction or imposition of a penalty as a retribution for an offense". There's many interpretations of how a punishment can be, but a demotion falls under that. I meant punishment in that case (And for a normal player...) by giving a forum warn/ban. A demotion serves it's corrective behavior enough. I, nor did the senior staff team, find it necessary to deal a forum punishment.
replies.body_tagged: I didn't intend to sound biased. In any case, a demotion is still a penalization. "The infliction or imposition of a penalty as a retribution for an offense". There's many interpretations of how a punishment can be, but a demotion falls under that. I meant punishment in that case (And for a normal player...) by giving a forum warn/ban. A demotion serves it's corrective behavior enough. I, nor did the senior staff team, find it necessary to deal a forum punishment.

replies.body:
Well I would rather not turn this whole thread into a flame war so I am going to state my opinion, do not get all fussy over my reply. I personally think you were a great mod Snow, you would always help me throughout my trial and was always a blast to talk to. I'm going to miss you on the staff team but at least I can see you otherwise. I hope you will re apply and maybe see you on the staff team again. Just act they way you acted around me and I think everyone will enjoy your positive attitude! Good luck if you ever apply and I can't wait to talk to you again <33. ~Acceqted.

P.S. Your laugh is amazing!
